intro: Pergularia africana, commonly known as African spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, succulent appearance. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or green, surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal regions. Pergularia africana is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in various African cultures for treating ailments.
